decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game through countermagic and removal spells while generating card advantage with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to generate value and stabilize the board. The inclusion of creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Snapcaster Mage provide additional utility and card advantage. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until it can stick a win condition like Entreat the Angels or Klothys, God of Destiny for the win.

The primary strategy of this deck is to quickly establish early threats such as Delver of Secrets and Dreadhorde Arcanist while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and mana denial with cards like Wasteland. Utilizing cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder, and efficient removal like Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to apply pressure and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. Oko, Thief of Crowns provides additional versatility and disruption, allowing for the deck to adapt to various board states and threats.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and card draw through a combination of creatures and spells, with the ultimate goal of reliably finding and casting powerful combo pieces like Natural Order and Craterhoof Behemoth to overwhelm the opponent. Other key cards like Gaea's Cradle, Heritage Druid, and Wirewood Symbiote are utilized to ramp up the deck's mana production and enable explosive plays. The inclusion of cards like Allosaurus Shepherd and Oko, Thief of Crowns provide additional utility and disruption to further support the deck's game plan of overwhelming the opponent with a lethal combo finish.

This UWx Control deck focuses on disruption and removal spells to deal with opponent's threats while maintaining card advantage through card draw and planeswalkers. It also includes a Replenish package to recycle enchantments like Shark Typhoon and Cast Out to continuously control the board. The deck aims to control the game by countering key spells, removing threats, and generating value from its enchantments and planeswalkers. The mana base is designed to support the demanding color requirements of the deck while also providing some flexibility through fetchlands and Mystic Sanctuary.

The deck focuses on quickly putting out powerful creatures like Emrakul, Uro, and Griselbrand onto the battlefield through the use of Show and Tell and Omniscience. By using these cards, the player can bypass traditional mana costs and overwhelm their opponent with high-impact threats. The deck includes a variety of card draw spells, counterspells, and protection spells to support the combo and ensure its success. Additionally, the presence of Cunning Wish allows for extra versatility and access to a sideboard of silver bullets in crucial situations.

The deck focuses on quickly getting out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath onto the battlefield through the use of Show and Tell and Omniscience. It also includes cards like Cunning Wish and Veil of Summer to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck is designed to quickly overwhelm opponents with its powerful creatures and create a dominating board presence.

This combo deck aims to combine Painter's Servant with Grindstone to mill the opponent's entire deck. It uses cards like Goblin Welder and Goblin Engineer to find and sacrifice key cards, while also disrupting opponents with cards like Blood Moon and Ensnaring Bridge. Karn, the Great Creator is used to tutor for artifacts and shut down opposing strategies. The deck also utilizes Seasoned Pyromancer and Arcum's Astrolabe for card advantage and mana fixing. The goal is to assemble the combo quickly while controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's game plan.

mainboard.name: Vito, Thorn of the Dusk Rose

decks.notes: The deck focuses on combining fast mana acceleration and graveyard manipulation to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Ashen Rider onto the battlefield. It aims to disrupt opponents' strategies by utilizing hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy, while also protecting its own game plan with cards like Unmask and Chancellor of the Annex. By reanimating big threats early in the game, the deck can overwhelm opponents and close out the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently set up and resolve a powerful combo using cards like Show and Tell, Omniscience, and Sneak Attack to cheat in big, game-ending creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck includes both card draw and counter spells to protect the combo and advance the game plan. The mana base is optimized to support the combo pieces with lands like Ancient Tomb and City of Traitors helping to accelerate the deck's strategy.

The deck focuses on cheating powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul onto the battlefield quickly through the combo of Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The key concept is to use these cheat effects alongside cards like Omniscience to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats without having to pay their high mana costs. The deck also includes a package of counterspells and card draw to protect the combo and dig for the necessary pieces. Additionally, Cunning Wish allows for versatility in finding answers or additional combo pieces from the sideboard.

This deck utilizes the powerful combo of Show and Tell with cards like Sneak Attack and Omniscience to cheat big threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play quickly. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with these massive creatures and take control of the game before they have a chance to respond. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Veil of Summer to protect its strategy and ensure it can execute its game plan effectively.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence and applying pressure on the opponent through efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dreadhorde Arcanist, supported by a suite of cheap and versatile spells like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to efficiently use its resources to control the game and deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible, utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Daze to maintain card advantage and tempo advantage. Ultimately, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent can set up their own strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost spells and efficient creatures to maintain pressure on the opponent and disrupt their plays. By combining powerful one-drop creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dreadhorde Arcanist with disruptive counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, the deck aims to quickly establish board dominance and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. With a mix of burn spells, card draw, and versatile threats like True-Name Nemesis and Brazen Borrower, the deck has the flexibility to adapt to a variety of situations and opponents.

The deck focuses on using cheap and efficient spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan while also deploying threats quickly to apply pressure. It utilizes powerful cards like Delver of Secrets, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and True-Name Nemesis to put the opponent on the back foot, while also including counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its own game plan. The deck aims to win through tempo advantage, using its efficient creatures and burn spells to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while maintaining board presence through the use of creatures with powerful enter the battlefield abilities. By utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and cards like Meddling Mage and Force of Will to control the opponent's plays, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent. The deck also has powerful removal in Swords to Plowshares and Baleful Strix to deal with threats. The combination of disruptive creatures, efficient removal, and card advantage engines make this deck a strong contender in the Legacy format.
